title: Xenomorph on the Loose in 'Alien: Earth' Scary Alien Day Promo Vids
description: "This ship collected five different life-forms from the darkest corners of the universe... Each one a unique, deadly species." FX has revealed two more promo spots for Alien Day celebrating their upcoming series Alien: Earth. Everyone knows that April 26th (4/26) is Alien Day, in honor of the planet LV-426 from the original 1979 movie. When a mysterious space vessel crash-lands, a young woman (Sydney Chandler) and a ragtag group of tactical soldiers make a fateful discovery that puts them face-to-face with the planet's greatest threat. This is set in 2120 when "five corporations - Prodigy, Weyland-Yutani, Lynch, Dynamic and Threshold - wield the power of nations, and proprietary advancements in technology provide the promise of a new tomorrow." Uh oh. Created & directed by Noah Hawley. The cast includes Alex Lawther, Timothy Olyphant, Essie Davis, Samuel Blenkin, Babou Ceesay, David Rysdahl, Adrian Edmondson, Adarsh Gourav, Moe Bar-El & others. The first teaser talks about the alien species being brought back, and the second (disgusting) teaser is a 3-minute long VFX video showing a xenomorph forming in gestation. So gross. Hoping they'll announce the final release date for this soon - most likely at the end of the summer. Here's […]
author: Alex Billington
excerpt: "This ship collected five different life-forms from the darkest corners of the universe... Each one a unique, deadly species." FX has revealed two more promo spots for Alien Day celebrating their upcoming series Alien: Earth. Everyone knows that April 26th (4/26) is Alien Day, in honor of the planet LV-426 from the original 1979 movie.
text: TRAILERS by April 26, 2025Source: YouTube "This ship collected five different life-forms from the darkest corners of the universe... Each one a unique, deadly species." FX has revealed two more promo spots for Alien Day celebrating their upcoming series Alien: Earth. Everyone knows that April 26th (4/26) is Alien Day, in honor of the planet LV-426 from the original 1979 movie. When a mysterious space vessel crash-lands, a young woman (Sydney Chandler) and a ragtag group of tactical soldiers make a fateful discovery that puts them face-to-face with the planet's greatest threat. This is set in 2120 when "five corporations - Prodigy, Weyland-Yutani, Lynch, Dynamic and Threshold - wield the power of nations, and proprietary advancements in technology provide the promise of a new tomorrow." Uh oh. Created & directed by Noah Hawley. The cast includes Alex Lawther, Timothy Olyphant, Essie Davis, Samuel Blenkin, Babou Ceesay, David Rysdahl, Adrian Edmondson, Adarsh Gourav, Moe Bar-El & others. The first teaser talks about the alien species being brought back, and the second (disgusting) teaser is a 3-minute long VFX video showing a xenomorph forming in gestation. So gross. Hoping they'll announce the final release date for this soon - most likely at the end of the summer. Here's the Alien Day promo videos (+ poster) for Noah Hawley's series Alien: Earth via FX's YouTube: You can rewatch the very first teaser for Hulu's Alien: Earth series right here and the second teaser here. When a mysterious space vessel crash-lands on Earth, a young woman (Sydney Chandler) and a ragtag group of tactical soldiers make a fateful discovery that puts them face-to-face with the planet’s greatest threat in FX’s highly anticipated TV series Alien: Earth from creator Noah Hawley. Alien: Earth is a new sci-fi series created and written by filmmaker / writer Noah Hawley, director of the film Lucy in the Sky previously, along with writer & directing the "Legion" and "Fargo" TV series, and writing for "The Unusuals" and "My Generation". It's written by and directed and showrun entirely by Noah Hawley. No other writing credits are available yet. Produced by Scott Free, 26 Keys Productions, 20th Television, and FXP. Executive produced by Hawley, Ridley Scott, Dana Gonzales, and Joseph E. Iberti. FX will launch this Alien: Earth series streaming on Hulu starting sometime summer 2025 - stay tuned for a final date. Still excited for it? Find more posts in: Sci-Fi, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
April 26, 2025
Source: YouTube

"This ship collected five different life-forms from the darkest corners of the universe... Each one a unique, deadly species." FX has revealed two more promo spots for Alien Day celebrating their upcoming series Alien: Earth. Everyone knows that April 26th (4/26) is Alien Day, in honor of the planet LV-426 from the original 1979 movie. When a mysterious space vessel crash-lands, a young woman (Sydney Chandler) and a ragtag group of tactical soldiers make a fateful discovery that puts them face-to-face with the planet's greatest threat. This is set in 2120 when "five corporations - Prodigy, Weyland-Yutani, Lynch, Dynamic and Threshold - wield the power of nations, and proprietary advancements in technology provide the promise of a new tomorrow." Uh oh. Created & directed by Noah Hawley. The cast includes Alex Lawther, Timothy Olyphant, Essie Davis, Samuel Blenkin, Babou Ceesay, David Rysdahl, Adrian Edmondson, Adarsh Gourav, Moe Bar-El & others. The first teaser talks about the alien species being brought back, and the second (disgusting) teaser is a 3-minute long VFX video showing a xenomorph forming in gestation. So gross. Hoping they'll announce the final release date for this soon - most likely at the end of the summer.

Here's the Alien Day promo videos (+ poster) for Noah Hawley's series Alien: Earth via FX's YouTube:

You can rewatch the very first teaser for Hulu's Alien: Earth series right here and the second teaser here.

When a mysterious space vessel crash-lands on Earth, a young woman (Sydney Chandler) and a ragtag group of tactical soldiers make a fateful discovery that puts them face-to-face with the planet’s greatest threat in FX’s highly anticipated TV series Alien: Earth from creator Noah Hawley. Alien: Earth is a new sci-fi series created and written by filmmaker / writer Noah Hawley, director of the film Lucy in the Sky previously, along with writer & directing the "Legion" and "Fargo" TV series, and writing for "The Unusuals" and "My Generation". It's written by and directed and showrun entirely by Noah Hawley. No other writing credits are available yet. Produced by Scott Free, 26 Keys Productions, 20th Television, and FXP. Executive produced by Hawley, Ridley Scott, Dana Gonzales, and Joseph E. Iberti. FX will launch this Alien: Earth series streaming on Hulu starting sometime summer 2025 - stay tuned for a final date. Still excited for it?

Find more posts in: Sci-Fi, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer
